2.questions: Team members are passionate and unguarded in their discussion of issues.

3.questions: Team members are quick to point out the contributions and achievements of others.

4.questions: Team meetings are interesting and compelling (not boring).

5.questions: During team meetings, the most important—and difficult—issues are discussed.

6.questions: Team members acknowledge their weaknesses to one another.

7.questions: Team members voice their opinions even at the risk of causing disagreement.

8.questions: Team members point out one another’s unproductive behaviors.

9.questions: The team has a reputation for high performance.

10.questions: Team members ask for help without hesitation.

11.questions: Team members leave meetings confident that everyone is committed to the decisions that were agreed upon.

12.questions: During discussions, team members challenge one another about how they arrived at their conclusions and opinions.

13.questions: Team members ask one another for input regarding their areas of responsibility.

14.questions: When the team fails to achieve collective goals, each member takes personal responsibility to improve the team’s performance.

15.questions: Team members willingly make sacrifices in their areas for the good of the team.

16.questions: Team members are quick to confront peers about problems in their respective areas of responsibility.

17.questions: Team members acknowledge and tap into one another’s skills and expertise.

18.questions: Team members solicit one another’s opinions during meetings.

19.questions: Team members end discussions with clear and specific resolutions and calls to action.

20.questions: Team members question one another about their current approaches and methods.

21.questions: The team ensures that poor performers feel pressure and the expectation to improve.

22.questions: Team members willingly apologize to one another.

23.questions: Team members communicate unpopular opinions to the group.

24.questions: The team is clear about its direction and priorities.

25.questions: Team members are slow to seek credit for their own contributions.

26.questions: All members of the team are held to the same high standards.

27.questions: When conflict occurs, the team confronts and deals with the issue before moving to another subject.

28.questions: The team is aligned around common objectives.

29.questions: The team consistently achieves its objectives.

30.questions: The team is decisive, even when perfect information is not available.

31.questions: Team members value collective success more than individual achievement.

32.questions: Team members are unguarded and genuine with one another.

33.questions: Team members can comfortably discuss their personal lives with one another.

35.questions: Team members consistently follow through on promises and commitments.

36.questions: Team members offer unprovoked, constructive feedback to one another.

37.questions: Team members place little importance on titles and status. (A high score on this statement indicates that titles and status are NOT important to team members.)

38.questions: Team members support group decisions even if they initially disagreed.
